Key Match Events: Bryce Harper hit a two-run single against New York Mets pitcher Jose Quintana in the fifth inning
Bryce Harper hit a home run off facing of the second deck in right-center in the second inning
Alec Bohm hit his 19th home run in the third inning
Harper added a two-run single in a three-run fifth inning that included Trea Turner’s run-scoring grounder
Gregory Soto struck out Mark Vientos with two men on to end the eighth
Post-Match Reflections: Harper said he was very happy with getting 20 home runs and hopes to get a few more
Wheeler improved to 4-0 in his last six starts
Thomson said they want to see how a few of their relievers look pitching three days in a row in the final week of the season, if possible
Mets manager Buck Showalter said the plan remains for Marte to rejoin the team for the final weekend of the season at home against the Phillies next week
Miscellaneous Highlights: Philadelphia would clinch a playoff berth Sunday with a win and a loss by either the Chicago Cubs or Miami Marlins
Harper’s homer gave the Phillies five players with 20 or more home runs for the third time after 2007 and '09
Bohm could make it their first season with six players with 20 or more home runs
